conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph of two objects, A and B, moving along the same straight line from the same starting position.
Identify the starting position on the velocity-time graph where both objects begin moving.
Observe the velocity-time graph for both objects showing velocity as a function of time.
Determine the time at which the two objects are farthest apart when the distance between them is at its maximum.
Identify the time \( t_1 \) when the distance between the two objects is at its maximum, when the velocity of object A is greater than that of object B.
Identify the time \( t_2 \) when the distance between the two objects is at its minimum, when the velocity of object A is less than that of object B.
Since the objects start from the same position, the time at which they are farthest apart is the difference between \( t_2 \) and \( t_1 \).
Calculate the difference between \( t_2 \) and \( t_1 \) to find the time at which the two objects are farthest apart.
Verify that the calculated time matches the reasoning process.
At time \( t_2 \), the two objects are farthest apart.
